borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposed&nbsp;front rooflights, due to their position within the front roofslope, scale and design, would appear as incongruous roof additions, which would not be a response to the positive aspects of the local context. The proposal fails to respect or positively respond to the original architecture, fenestration and roof form of the host building, resulting in harm to the character and the appearance of the host property and the visual amenity of the wider terrace and Becontree Estate which is a non-designated&nbsp;heritage asset.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><p></p><ul><li>Paragraphs 134 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);</li><li><span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">Policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></li><li>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</li><li>Policies BP2 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">The Residential Extensions; and</span></li><li><span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">Paragraph </span>5.6.3&nbsp;<span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">of the </span>Residential Extensions and Alterations <span pt="" sans="" style="line-height: 107%;"> Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</span></li></ul>

<p style="">The proposed hip-to-gable roof extension and rear dormer window by reason of combined bulk, size, scale, massing,  design and location of the application site would fail to be a subordinate addition and would visually dominate the roof space. The proposal fails to respect or positively respond to the original architecture, fenestration and roof form of the host building, resulting in harm to the character and the appearance of the host property and the visual amenity of the wider terrace and Becontree Estate which is a non-designated heritage asset.&nbsp;As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</p><div><ul><li>Paragraphs 134 and 203 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC, July 2021);</li><li><span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">Policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span></li><li>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);</li><li>Policies BP2 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);</li><li><span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%"></span>Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">The Residential Extensions; and</span><br></li><li><span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">Paragraph </span>5.6.3&nbsp;<span pt="" sans="" style="line-height:107%">of the </span>Residential Extensions and Alterations <span pt="" sans="" style="line-height: 107%;"> Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</span></li></ul></div>
description: Construction of a hip-to-gable roof extension to accommodate a rear dormer extension including three roof lights to the front to facilitate the conversion of the roof space of 18b Basedale Road into habitable accommodation
